result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy R. Fredrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy R. Fredrick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy R. Fredrick was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

--serve 1 day in Jefferson County Jail [time served]

--6 days credit for time already served given

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy R. Fredrick

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 11:11am
 Defendant Jeremy R. Fredrick in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; the victim impact statement is submitted.
The Court grants leave for the State to file an Amended Information. 
Service of the Amended Information admitted; the charge and maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


On Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Fredrick to:
--serve 1 day in Jefferson County Jail [time served]
--6 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in the entry of a civil judgment.
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

ADA Teuber motions for read-in and dismiss Count #1.  The Court indicates that it has not read in Count #1. Instead the Court is dismissing Count #1 [outright dismissal].  
recess 11:24am
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:56 PM 
Defendant Jeremy R. Fredrick in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Jeremy R. Fredrick.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Fischer anticipates resolution, negotiation remain ongoing. 

Scheduling is discussed.
recess: 2:58pm 
NEXT: Status on 8/15/22 at 10:30am

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 8:38am 
Defendant Jeremy R. Fredrick in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Fredrick waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:43am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 13th at 9:40am-only counsel need to appear,   (2) Status Conference on July 26th at 2:30pm

Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Conditions of this bond include:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1 as defined in the Criminal Complaint and Victim/Witness Key
--no possession of dangerous weapons

[ml] Case called at 1:23PM
Defendant Jeremy R. Fredrick appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1 as defined in the Criminal Complaint and Victim/Witness Key
--no possession of dangerous weapons

recess 1:28PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 05/11 at 11:00AM  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 06/21 at 8:30AM
